TopicTitle: Career Mode. Can't start a thing!

Articles.Content: So basically I can't seem to start the games career mode. I can't build a ship since it won't allow me to select the Mk1 command pod. But then when I go to the R&D and unlock it nothing actually happens, instead when I return to the VAB it's still locked and returning to the R&D shows it as unlocked along with a duplicate that isn't unlocked. Repeating the process just causes more of them to stack up in R&D without ever unlocking any in the VAB. So any ideas what's going on here?
Do you have any mods installed? Please don't make fun of me, but all I have installed in mechjeb 2.0.9, and career mode doesn't start me off with any command components either.
I am having the exact same problem, and I just ran the patcher today to update, so no mods.
I'm just gonna give the bog standard semi obvious advice of do a re-install with no mods.
I've noticed in career mode i can see some other parts from KW set, but they are greyed out. perhaps you have a modified command pod and it's greyed out because it's now a non-stock part?

My first instinct would be to tell you to go to the science screen, select the first node and then go to the right hand side of the screen where it lists the parts you get in that node and click each one. This "buys" the parts. I've heard of this bug a couple of times so I hope this fixes it for you
sometimes when you install a mod or part that appears on a tech node to which you already have access, you need to select that part individually in the R&D center menu to enable it

Hey, did you find out what was wrong, I seem to be having the same issue, don't want to waste half a day downloading/reinstalling again if there's a quicker fix. I'm using windows 8.1 My KSP installation was from windows 8 copied the steam KSP directory, installed the update, there are two sets of everything in "start". Can't select anything to get started. Chicken and egg science issue

Okay, for any future kerbalers with this problem, I deleted (cut and pasted to an unrelated folder) all 142 "parts" from the KSP > Parts. This worked, yay!

Edited November 27, 2013 by Johnno
Merged posts
